com.github.i49.hibiscus.problems

Interface Problem

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayDuplicateItemProblem, ArrayLengthProblem, ArrayTooLongProblem, ArrayTooShortProblem, AssertionFailureProblem, ExclusiveLowerBoundProblem, ExclusiveUpperBoundProblem, InclusiveLowerBoundProblem, InclusiveUpperBoundProblem, InvalidFormatProblem, MissingPropertyProblem, NoSuchEnumeratorProblem, NumericRangeProblem, StringLengthProblem, StringPatternProblem, StringTooLongProblem, StringTooShortProblem, TypedProblem, TypeMismatchProblem, UnknownPropertyProblem

    public interface Problem
    Common interface which should be implemented by all classes representing problems that will be detected by validation of JSON documents.

    When the JSON validator verifies a JSON document, it reports detected violations against given schema as problems. Detected problems can be obtained through ValidationResult interface, which is returned from the invocation of the validation methods. Following code shows how to handle the problems detected by the JSON validator. 

    
 ValidationResult result = validator.validate(...);
 for (Problem p: result.getProblems()) {
     // should handle each detected problem here.
 }

    Each kind of problems is encapsulated in its own class defined in this package. These problem classes implement the common interface Problem. This interface provides several useful methods in order to give users the clues on the found problem.

    1. location of problem

      getLocation() method provides where the problem was detected in original JSON document. The information includes line and column numbers in the JSON document.

    2. value that caused problem

      getCauseValue() method provides JsonValue that caused the problem.

    3. JSON pointer

      getPointer() method provides JsonPointer which refers to the JSON value that caused the problem.

    4. description of problem

      getDescription() method gives the textural description of the problem detected.

    5. string representing of problem

      getMessage() method gives the string representation of the problem which includes the location and the description of the problem. This is handy method to display the problem for the application users instantly.

    The table shown below lists all problems that the JSON validator can detect.

    The list of problems
    No. Problem Class Causing Types Description
    1 ArrayDuplicateItemProblem array() Two elements in an array have the same value.
    2 ArrayLengthProblem array() The number of elements in an array is not same exactly as expected.
    3 ArrayTooLongProblem array() Array has elements more than allowed.
    4 ArrayTooShortProblem array() Array has elements fewer than required.
    5 AssertionFailureProblem all but nil() An assertion made on a type was failed.
    6 ExclusiveLowerBoundProblem integer(), number() A numeric value is less than or equal to the lower bound of the valid range.
    7 ExclusiveUpperBoundProblem integer(), number() A numeric value is greater than or equal to the upper bound of the valid range.
    8 InclusiveLowerBoundProblem integer(), number() A numeric value is less than the lower bound of the valid range.
    9 InclusiveUpperBoundProblem integer(), number() A numeric value is greater than the upper bound of the valid range.
    10 InvalidFormatProblem string() A value does not have the expected format declared in the schema.
    11 MissingPropertyProblem object() An object does not have a mandatory property.
    12 NoSuchEnumeratorProblem boolean(), integer(), number(), string() A value does not match any value in the enumeration allowed for the type.
    13 StringLengthProblem string() A string does not have exactly the same as expected characters.
    14 StringPatternProblem string() A string value does not match the expected pattern specified as a regular expression.
    15 StringTooLongProblem string() A string is longer than allowed.
    16 StringTooShortProblem string() A string is shorter than required.
    16 TypeMismatchProblem all The type of a value in JSON document does not match the type declared in the schema.
    17 UnknownPropertyProblem object() An object has a property which is not explicitly declared in the schema.
    See Also:
    ValidationResult

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JsonValue getCauseValue()
      Returns the actual JsonValue which caused this problem.
      default String getDescription()
      Returns the description of this problem for the default locale.
      String getDescription(Locale locale)
      Returns the description of this problem for specific locale.
      JsonLocation getLocation()
      Returns the location where this problem was found including line and column numbers on the input JSON document.
      default String getMessage()
      Returns the message of this problem for the default locale.
      String getMessage(Locale locale)
      Returns the message of this problem for specific locale.
      JsonPointer getPointer()
      Returns the JSON pointer which refers to the value that caused this problem.
      Problem setLocation(JsonLocation location)
      Assigns the location where this problem was found.
      void setPointer(JsonPointer pointer, JsonDocument document)
      Assigns the JSON pointer which refers to the value that caused this problem.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        JsonLocation getLocation()
        Returns the location where this problem was found including line and column numbers on the input JSON document.
        Returns:
        JsonLocation object which holds the location of this problem.
        See Also:
        JsonLocation

      • setLocation

        Problem setLocation(JsonLocation location)
        Assigns the location where this problem was found.
        Parameters:
        location - the location which indicates where this problem was found. null indicates the location is unknown.
        Returns:
        this problem.

      • getPointer

        JsonPointer getPointer()
        Returns the JSON pointer which refers to the value that caused this problem.
        Returns:
        the JSON pointer to the cause value.

      • setPointer

        void setPointer(JsonPointer pointer,
                JsonDocument document)
        Assigns the JSON pointer which refers to the value that caused this problem.
        Parameters:
        pointer - the JSON pointer to the cause value.
        document - the JSON document to which the JSON pointer refers.

      • getCauseValue

        JsonValue getCauseValue()
        Returns the actual JsonValue which caused this problem.
        Returns:
        the actual JsonValue which caused this problem.

      • getDescription

        default String getDescription()
        Returns the description of this problem for the default locale.

        Calling this method is equivalent to call getDescription(Locale.getDefault()).

        Returns:
        the description of this problem.
        See Also:
        getDescription(Locale)

      • getDescription

        String getDescription(Locale locale)
        Returns the description of this problem for specific locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale for which the description is desired. if the argument is null, default locale is used instead.
        Returns:
        the description of this problem.

      • getMessage

        default String getMessage()
        Returns the message of this problem for the default locale.

        This is a handy method to display this problem to the application users. The message to be returned includes both the location and the description of this problem.

        Calling this method is equivalent to call getMessage(Locale.getDefault()).

        Returns:
        the message of this problem.
        See Also:
        getMessage(Locale)

      • getMessage

        String getMessage(Locale locale)
        Returns the message of this problem for specific locale.

        This is a handy method to display this problem to the application users. The message to be returned includes both the location and the description of this problem.

        Parameters:
        locale - the locale for which the message is desired. if the argument is null, default locale is used instead.
        Returns:
        the message of this problem.
